greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array T(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals in which column k gives the partial sums of column k of A144064.
comment: It appears that row 2 is A034856.
Column 1 is the EULER transform of 2,1,1,1,1,1,1,1...
Column 2 is the EULER transform of 3,2,2,2,2,2,2,2...
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
maple: seq(seq(A(d-k, k), k=0..d), d=0..14); # _Alois P. Heinz_, May 20 2013
mathematica: etr[p_] := Module[{b}, b[n_] := b[n] = If[n == 0, 1, Sum[Sum[d*p[d], {d, Divisors[ j]}]*b[n-j], {j, 1, n}]/n]; b]; A[n_, k_] := etr[Function[{j}, k + If[j == 1, 1, 0]]][n]; Table[Table[A[d-k, k], {k, 0, d}], {d, 0, 14}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 05 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Jun 27 2012
